metalign.parsing

Class NoteListGenerator

  • java.lang.Object
    • metalign.parsing.NoteListGenerator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    NoteEventParser

    public class NoteListGenerator
extends java.lang.Object
implements NoteEventParser
    A NoteListGenerator parses Note On and Note Off events and generates a List of the MidiNotes present in any given song.
    Author:
    Andrew McLeod - 11 Feb, 2015

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private java.util.LinkedList<MidiNote> activeNotes
      A list of the MidiNotes which have not yet been closed.

      A list of MidiNotes which have already been closed.
      protected TimeTracker timeTracker
      The TimeTracker for this NoteListGenerator.

    • Method Detail

      • noteOn

        public MidiNote noteOn(int key,
                       int velocity,
                       long tick,
                       int channel)
        Description copied from interface: NoteEventParser
        Process a Note On event.
        Specified by:
        noteOn in interface NoteEventParser
        Parameters:
        key - The key pressed. This will be a number between 1 and 88 for piano.
        velocity - The velocity of the press. This is a value between 1 and 127 inclusive.
        tick - The midi tick location of this event.
        channel - The midi channel this note came from.
        Returns:
        The MidiNote we just created.

      • noteOff

        public void noteOff(int key,
                    long tick,
                    int channel)
             throws javax.sound.midi.InvalidMidiDataException
        Description copied from interface: NoteEventParser
        Process a Note Off event.
        Specified by:
        noteOff in interface NoteEventParser
        Parameters:
        key - The midi key which has been turned off. This value is between 39 and 127, inclusive, for piano.
        tick - The midi tick location of this event.
        channel - The midi channel this note came from.
        Throws:
        javax.sound.midi.InvalidMidiDataException - If a note off event doesn't match any previously seen note on events.

      • getNoteList

        public java.util.List<MidiNote> getNoteList()
        Returns a list of the notes present in this song, in time order.
        Returns:
        A list of the notes present as described above.

      • getIncomingLists

        public java.util.List<java.util.List<MidiNote>> getIncomingLists()
        Returns a List of the incoming note lists. This is exactly the sequence of note lists which should be fed into the MidiModel.handleIncoming(List) method.
        Returns:
        A List of incoming note lists, where each individual list contains all of the notes which onset at a particular time, sorted by offset time, and the list of listsis itself sorted by onset time.
